Package com.example.employ_events

Class InvitationsListFragmentTest

java.lang.Object
com.example.employ_events.InvitationsListFragmentTest
public class InvitationsListFragmentTest extends Object
Author:
Tina Test class for the InvitationsListFragment. This class performs unit tests to validate the functionality of the InvitationsListFragment, such as verifying that the RecyclerView is displayed correctly, and that the data is properly loaded and displayed in the fragment. Tests include: - Checking if the RecyclerView is visible. - Verifying the RecyclerView has the expected number of items. This test uses Firebase Firestore for creating test profiles and events and leverages Espresso for UI testing.

  • Method Details

    • launchActivity

      public void launchActivity()

    • setUp

      public void setUp() throws InterruptedException
      Set up the test environment before each test case. This method does the following: - Creates a test user profile and test event with an invitation for the user. - Initializes SharedPreferences with the test unique user ID. - Launches the InvitationsListFragment for testing.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException

    • testA_FragmentLaunchesWithRecyclerView

      public void testA_FragmentLaunchesWithRecyclerView()
      Test to check if the fragment launches correctly and the RecyclerView is displayed. This test validates the visibility of the RecyclerView in the fragment.

    • tearDown

      public void tearDown()
      Clean up after the test is finished by closing the fragment scenario to release resources.

    • createTestUserProfile

      public static void createTestUserProfile(String uniqueID, CountDownLatch latch)
      Helper method to create a test user profile in Firestore.
      Parameters:
      uniqueID - The unique ID of the user to create.

    • createTestEventWithInvitation

      public static void createTestEventWithInvitation(String eventId, String uniqueID, CountDownLatch latch)
      Helper method to create a test event with an invitation for the given user.
      Parameters:
      eventId - The ID of the event to create.
      uniqueID - The unique ID of the user to invite.
